1. Distances (1/2)
▪ Let x = (x1, x2, …, xn) and y = (y1, y2, …, yn) be two data objects
– n: the number of dimensions
– xk and yk: the kth attributes of x and y, respectively
▪ Distances: dissimilarities with certain properties
▪ Euclidean distance
– The straight-line distance between two points
54

text.text: ▪ Let x = (x1, x2, …, xn) and y = (y1, y2, …, yn) be two data objects

– n: the number of dimensions
– xk and yk: the kth attributes of x and y, respectively

▪ Distances: dissimilarities with certain properties
▪ Euclidean distance
– The straight-line distance between two points
